1.content:
The lobby of the police station is tiny and crammed with people. Body odor and sweat invade your nostrils as you look through the sea of humanity and notice a detective waving you over. You push through the crowd of people and make your way over.

"Thanks for coming down," the detective says, as he ushers you past the lobby and into the heart of the precinct. "This should only take a couple of minutes."

He leads you into a small room with a large pane of glass looking into another.

Moments later, five men are filed into the room on the other side of the glass.

"Take your time," the detective said. "Do you see the man who robbed the store in there?"

You don't need to take your time.

MAN #1 is too short.

MAN #2 has the wrong tattoos.

MAN #3 has the wrong hair color.

MAN #5 is too young.

But MAN #4... he's the guy. You knew it the minute they filed into the room. You'd never forget that face, as long as you lived.

"Well?" Pressed the detective. "Is he in there?"

You pause, remembering the robber's last words to you.

"Look," the detective said. "The security camera in the store is broken. The clerk filed a report, but we need you to corroborate his story."

You swallow hard... and make your choice.
1.title: Pick A Number

11.content:
"I'm sorry," you tell the detective, "But he's not in there."

"Are you sure?"

"Yeah, I'm sure."

"Listen," the detective said, lowering his voice. "If this guy intimidated you, or threatened you in some way, we'll protect you. And the best way to do that is to put him behind bars. So please, look again. Is he in there?"

You seriously consider his words.
11.title: No, he's not in there.

111.content:
You shake your head.

"I'm sorry," you reply. "But he's just not in there."

The detective nods somberly. As he walks you outside, he waves an officer toward the lineup room.

"Let them go," he told the officer.

As you stand outside waiting for a cab, you see the robber emerge from the precinct. The two of you make eye contact; he smiles and winks at you as he walks off down the street... a free man.
111.title: No, he's really not there.

112.content:
You break down and confess that #4 is the guy who robbed the store.

"Are you sure?" The detective asked.

You nod your head.

"That's him."

The detective thanks you and whispers something to an officer just outside the room.

On the other side of the glass, you see officers come into the room and handcuff #4. He struggles and breaks free, running up to the mirrored glass.

"You bitch! I know it's you in there! You're dead! You hear me? Dead!"

The officers wrestle him down and drag him off.

"It's okay," the detective reassures you. "He won't be bothering anyone anymore."

The detective escorts you out of the precinct and calls you a cab home.

-----------------------

The next morning, your phone rings.
112.title: Okay, it's #4.

1121.content:
"Hello?"

"I'm afraid I have some bad news."

The detective's voice on the other end of the line causes your heart to sink into the pit of your stomach.

"He posted bail about an hour ago. The judge wouldn't remand him. If you want, we can arrange a police escort to and from work, until the trial."
1121.title: Pick up the phone

11211.content:
You agree to the police escort, and the detective arranges for one to meet you at your office that night.

Throughout the day, you try to focus on your work, but find your thoughts always returning to the robber. Does he know who you are? Would he track you down? If he did, would the police escort be enough?

Unfortunately, you'd never find out of the escort would be enough... because while you were walking back from lunch, a strong arm pulled you into a side alley.

The robber pushes you up against the wall, clapping a hand over your mouth.

"Hiya girlie... think I'd forget about my promise?"

He smiles wickedly and you swallow hard.
11211.title: Ask for the police escort.

11212.content:
You thank the detective for his consideration, but decline the police escort, reasoning that you're perfectly capable of taking care of yourself... and the guy doesn't even know who you are anyway.

You grab your things and head for the door.

Opening it, you jump in surprise as the robber stands on the other side of the door, smiling wickedly at you.

"Bet you didn't think I'd keep my promise, did ya?"

He pushes his way inside and closes the door behind him.
11212.title: Decline the offer.

1122.content:
You ignore the phone, and go about your daily routine. If it's important, whoever it is will call back.

Your day continues uneventfully, until you close up the office and head for the elevator. You've just stepped on when someone else pushes in before the doors close.

It's the robber!

He pushes the emergency stop button on the elevator and turns to you.

"I tried calling this morning, but you didn't pick up."

"How did you..."

"Get out? It's not the first time I've posted bail, sweetheart. Now it's time to make good on my promise."

He moves in and you start to scream.
1122.title: Don't answer it

113.content: Knowing full well that #4 was the man responsible, you instead implicate one of the other four men in the room. The detective thanks you for your time and sets in motion the proceedings to convict this innocent man.
113.title: Okay, it's [anyone other than #4].

12.content:
You point to the fourth guy in the lineup.

"That's the guy," you say confidently. "He's the one."

The detective looks hard at you.

"Sure?"

"Yeah," you reply.

The detective nods to the other officers in the room, who go next door and handcuff the robber and lead him from the room.

As the detective escorts you out of the precinct, he shakes your hand.

"Thanks again for your help. We'll be in touch if we need anything else."

-------------------------

Sure enough, a two weeks later, the detective calls you back.

"Look, our case is good," the detective said. "But we really need you to testify against this guy. Put him away for good."
12.title: Yes, it's #4!

121.content:
Two weeks later, you take the stand and testify to what you saw that night.

It's an open and shut case; the jury convicts after less than thirty minutes of deliberation.

"You bitch!" The robber screams as he's led back to his cell. "I'm going to get you for this!"

You squirm a little in your seat, until the District Attorney places a reassuring hand on your shoulder and reminds you that the robber is going to spend the rest of his life in prison.
121.title: Yes, testify.

122.content:
You tell the detective that you're just not comfortable testifying against the guy.

"Are you sure?" He asks. "We really need this."

"I know," you reply. "But I just can't."

The detective mutters something about thanks for your time and abruptly hangs up.

-------------------------

You go about your daily life, never knowing whether the robber was convicted or acquitted. You have no idea whether he's free or in prison... and every time you go by a dark alley, or step into a convenience store, you wonder if you'll run into him again.
122.title: No, don't testify.

13.content:
"Thanks," the detective said. "You've been a big help."

You walk out of the police precinct with the knowledge that you most likely just sent an innocent man to jail.
13.title: Yes, it's [anyone but #4]!

info.brief_description: After witnessing a crime, you're asked to identify the man responsible.
info.description:
Here's the setup:

You're a successful businesswoman in the city. You're independent and make good money, but live on your own and aren't dating anyone at the moment. Your parents live a few hours north of the city, and other than the occasional after work get together, you pretty much keep to yourself.

One night, you're looking forward to a glass of wine and a nice bubble bath to help you relax, when you realize you're out of wine. There's a liquor store one block over and you quickly run down to grab a bottle. You select a decent bottle and move to the register to pay for it when a man bursts in with a gun and holds up the clerk. After getting the money from the register, he knocks out the clerk with the butt of his gun and turns to leave.

The he notices you and your expensive jewelry. He makes a move toward you, but sirens in the distance give him pause.

Before leaving, he glares at you.

"If you tell anyone about this, I'll fuckin' kill you."

And with that, he disappeared.


A week later, you receive a call from a detective. The liquor store clerk filed charges, and they wanted you to come down and look at a lineup.

Reluctantly, you give in and agree to meet him downtown.
